content: The Act titled "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts. The Act defines terms like "blanket purchase agreement" and "basic ordering agreement" in accordance with specific sections of the Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 4. Ensuring small business participation in multiple award contracts, multi-agency contracts, and government-wide acquisition contracts. Section 15(g)(1) of the Small Business Act is amended to require the President to annually establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small business concerns. The Small Business Act is amended to establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to disabled veterans, qualified HUBZone small business concerns, socially and economically disadvantaged individuals, and women-owned small businesses. SEC. 5. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SMALL BUSINESS RESERVE. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the threshold from $100,000 to $200,000 and to include regulations for task or delivery orders placed against multiple award contracts, including those under the Federal Supply Schedule program. The Administrator will issue regulations within 120 days in consultation with the Administrator of General Services Administration. Within 120 days of enactment, regulations will be issued on ensuring correct size standards, implementing non-manufacturer rule, and displaying correct size information for small businesses in electronic ordering systems. Regulations will be issued to ensure correct size standards, implement non-manufacturer rule, and display correct size information for small businesses in electronic ordering systems. The Administrator of the General Services Administration will ensure that electronic ordering systems display the correct size information for small business concerns seeking the set aside of a task order. SEC. 6. Small business representation on the Federal Acquisition Regulatory Council is amended to include the Administrator of the Small Business Administration. In cases of an equal vote, the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy will have the deciding vote.
